REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

param contact_id:

The ID of the contact to retrieve

type contact_id:

int

param user:

The user to retrieve the contact for.

type user:

User

param db:

The database session.

type db:

Session

return:

The contact with the specified ID

rtype:

Contact__all__ = [

“create_contact”, “get_contact”, “get_contacts”, “update_contact”, “get_contacts_choice”, “get_contacts_birthdays”, “update_contact_status”, “remove_contact”, “update_avatar”

]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of notes.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Allows to search for a list of contacts, who have birthdays in 7 days from today.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to get the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The list of contacts.

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_choice(name: str | None, surname: str | None, email: str | None, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Allows to search for a contact based either on name, surname, or email.

Parameters:

  • name (str | None) – The name of the contact to search for.

  • surname (str | None) – The surname of the contact to search for.

  • email (str | None) – The email of the contact to search for.

  • user (User) – The user to get the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The requested contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the avatar of a user with the specified email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar is being updated.

  • url (str) – The URL of the new avatar image.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user whose avatar was updated.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • contact_id (int) – the specific the contact id that is updated

  • user (User) – The user to update contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact_status(body: ContactStatusUpdate, contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactStatusUpdate) – The updated data for the contact.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • user (User) – The user to get the contact.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶
Marks the specified email address as confirmed for user login.

When a user creates an account, they are typically sent a confirmation email to verify their email address. Once the user has clicked the confirmation link and their email address has been verified, this function should be called to mark the email as confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address to mark as confirmed.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Specify the type of parameter that will be passed into the function.

  • db (Session) – Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user with the specified email address

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the avatar of a user with the specified email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar is being updated.

  • url (str) – The URL of the new avatar image.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user whose avatar was updated.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the token used for user login.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user for which the token is being updated.

  • token (str | None) – The new token to use for login, or None to invalidate the token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. If the validation fails, an HTTPException with status code 400 is raised and returned to the user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Get the contact information from the request.

  • db (Session = Depends(get_db).) – Get the database session.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).) – Get the current user from the database.

Returns:

A contact object.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶
The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.
The function takes the following parameters:

  • contact_id: int, the id of the contact to be returned.

  • db: Session = Depends(get_db), an instance of a database session object that is used for querying and updating data in our database. This parameter is automatically injected into this function by FastAPI when it calls this function because we have added it as a dependency using @Depends(). We also use @Depends() to inject an instance of our current user into this function so that we can check if they are authorized to access this

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Specify the id of the contact to be fetched.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Get the database session.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).) – Get the current user.

Returns:

A contact object

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → list[src.database.model.Contact]¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

The skip and limit parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Skip the first n contacts.

  • limit (int) – Limit the number of contacts returned.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Inject the database session into the function.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).) – Get the current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts

Return type:

list

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → list[src.database.model.Contact]¶

The get_contacts_birthdays function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the current month.

The function takes two parameters: db and current_user. The db parameter is used to access the database, while the current_user parameter is used to get information about who made this request.

Parameters:

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Get the database session.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – Get the current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts, who have birthdays in 7 days

Return type:

list[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_choice(name: str | None = None, surname: str | None = None, email: EmailStr | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact | list[src.database.model.Contact]¶

The get_contacts_choice function is used to get a contact or the list of contacts either by name or by surname or by email.

The function takes in the following parameters:

  • name (str): The first name of the contact.

  • surname (str): The last name of the contact.

  • email (EmailStr): An email address for a user’s account.

Parameters:

  • name (str | None) – Get the name of a contact.

  • surname (str | None) – Filter the contacts by surname.

  • email (EmailStr | None) – Validate the email address.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Get a database session, which is required for accessing the contacts.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – Get the user that is currently logged in.

Returns:

A list of contacts or a contact that meet the criteria.

Return type:

Contact | list[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Specify the contact to be removed.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Pass the database session to the function.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – Get the current user.

Returns:

A contact, but it is not used in the frontend.

Return type:

None

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes in a ContactUpdate object, which is defined by the Pydantic library. This object contains all the fields that can be updated for a contact, and it validates them as well.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Pass the contact information to be updated.

  • contact_id (int) – Specify the contact ID to update.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Get the database session.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – Get the current user.

Returns:

A contact object.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact_status(body: ContactStatusUpdate, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → Contact¶

The update_contact_status function updates the status of a contact.

The function takes in a ContactStatusUpdate object, which contains the new status for the contact. It also takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be updated and two dependencies: db and current_user. The db dependency is used to access our database, while current_user is used to get information about who made this request.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactStatusUpdate) – Get the contact status from the request body.

  • contact_id (int) – Identify the contact to be updated.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Get a database session.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – Get the current user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → User¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – Get the current user.

Returns:

The current user

Return type:

User

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile=File()) – Receive the file from the user.

  • current_user (User=Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – Get the current user.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db)) – Get the database session.

Returns:

A user object.

Return type:

User

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → dict[str, str]¶

Provides the functionality of confirming the email address.

This function retrieves an email from the token and then retrieves the corresponding user from the database. If the user is not confirmed, it returns a message indicating that the email is not confirmed. If the user is confirmed, it updates the user’s status to confirmed and returns a message indicating that the email has been confirmed.

Parameters:

  • token (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The token used to authorize the email and user.

  • db (Session = Depends(get_db).) – The database session.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing the message, that the email was confirmed or was already confirmed.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If the user is not found in the database or if the email is already confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Provides login functionality to the application.

This function checks the validity of a user’s email and password and returns access and refresh tokens if the login is successful.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The request body containing the user’s email and password.

  • db (Session = Depends(get_db).) – The database session.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the user’s email or password is invalid or if the user’s email is not confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Provides the functionality of receiving a refreshed token.

This function first decodes the token and then retrieves the user from the database.Then it creates new access and refresh token. If the refresh token is invalid, it raises HTTPException that it is invalid.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(security).) – Checks credentials of user

  • db (Session = Depends(get_db).) – The database session.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the refreshed token is invalid, it gives an error of invalidity.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict[str, Any]¶
Provides the functionality of additional validation of the email address.

This function retrieves a user from the database with its email address. If the user is valid, it returns a message indicating that the email is confirmed. If the user is confirmed, but the second validation is required then it sends a request for with background tasks to send an email with url to the user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request body containing the email

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background task of sending an email notification to the user with the base URL of the additional validation.

  • request (Request) – Get the base_url of the application.

  • db (Session=Depends(get_db).) – The database session.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing the message, that the email was sent or to check email for confirmation.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Provides signup functionality for a new user to the application.

This function checks the validity of a user’s email and password and returns a new user and sends an email notification that it was successfully created.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The request body containing the user’s email, password, and username.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background task of sending an email notification to the user with the base URL of the request.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary containing the new user and a message that it was created.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Raises:

HTTPException 409 – If the user’s email, password, or username already exists, a conflict error will be raised.

REST API services Auth¶

Auth module¶

This is Module, which has authentication (the class was created).

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional timedelta of seconds for the expiration time of this token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data (dict) – Pass in the data to be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta (Optional[float] = None) – Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded access token

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes in a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which encodes the data into a string that can be decoded later. The function adds an expiration date to the encoded data, as well as some other information about how it was encoded.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data (dict) – Pass the data to be encoded into the token.

Returns:

A token that is used to verify the user’s email address

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data (dict) – Store the data that we want to encode into our token

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If it fails, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message &quot;Could not validate credentials&quot;.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token (str) – Pass in the refresh token that is sent from the client

Returns:

The email of the user who owns the refresh token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserRouter class. It takes an OAuth2 token as input and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token (str) – Get the token from the authorization header

  • db (Session) – Get the database connection from the dependency injection.

Returns:

The user object that is associated with the token

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶
The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token.

If the scope of the token is not ‘email_token’, then it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized). If there is a JWTError, then it raises an HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocessable Entity).

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token (str) – Pass the token value to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password (str) – Get the password from the user

Returns:

A password hash

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
redis = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=127.0.0.1,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the password that is being entered to the hashed password in the database

Returns:

A boolean value
